item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S7933-7934; text as passed Senate: CR S7933-7934; text of measure as introduced: CR S7932)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S7933-7934; text as passed Senate: CR S7933-7934; text of measure as introduced: CR S7932)

summary.text: Congratulates the San Antonio Spurs for winning the 2002-2003 National Basketball Association championship.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Congratulates the 2002-2003 San Antonio Spurs team and its coach, Greg Popovich, for winning their second National Basketball Association championship in five years.

bill.title: A resolution recognizing that the San Antonio Spurs are the 2002-2003 National Basketball Association champions and congratulating the team for its outstanding excellence, discipline, and dominance.

item.title: A resolution recognizing that the San Antonio Spurs are the 2002-2003 National Basketball Association champions and congratulating the team for its outstanding excellence, discipline, and dominance.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
